channel.title: A Few Questions
channel.description:
Hello there.
I have a few questions, and would appreciate any help you may be able to provide.
I am not a native English speaker; so my English isn't as a standard English fluentacy, so i'll make my apology now ^^
I am going away tomorrow, due to bad weather (snowing), flights are being delayed -_-; ^So i'd appreciate a quick response, if you're not busy.
While i'm away, I decided to use RSC server on a localhost, as i'll be far too busy to stay online to play a server; this way I can use it when i'm free and also use for educational purposes, to get a real insight to the game, aswell as playing it.
Here are a few my questions; please correct any information that is incorrect.
I'm using EasyRSC created by xEnt. I also have everything required to using RSCD_V25 too.
I basically want to know a few basic things, hope to add NPC's, make it possible to talk with an NPC; etc
1. Changing names of NPC's:- I've been looking through and taking looks at xml document, and believe this is done in the NPCdef.xml
2. NPC drops/rates:- I believe this is done in NPCdef.xml also.
From looking through NPCdef.xml, I also can clearly see that here you can change the Hits, Strength, Defense and Attack of an Npc, also respawn rates of time. *The rest i'll not bother touching, as i'm not 100% sure what will happen. With the drop rates, I am aware of the weight procedure, and will try a few things with that to get a decent drop rates.
3. Changing names of Items:- I believe by looking through ItemDef.xml, this is the correct place to change the name of an item.
4. Changing prices of shop items:- This is still quite unfamiliar to me. I see that in ItemDef.xml you have a <basePrice> x amount </basePrice>, which i'm thinking this would be the price when "selling" an item to the shop, not buying. Can anyone tell me where I can change the price of items that are already in-store.
5. Editing weapons/armours statistics:- I believe this can be done through Itemwieldabledef.xml, thanks to a great and informative tutorial that I read whilst looking through the search button.
6. Adding NPC's:- Also with this one, i'm not entirely sure. It also gets into a little confusion of what to edit. I am thinking that if I want to create a "new" npc, I can do this also in NPCDef.xml, making it drop new things, altering it's statistics, etc.
^I also believe i'd have to create the NPC's locations in NpcLoc.xml. My question with this is: How do I make an NPC stay on 1 place, without moving. For example:- Would I just use all the same coords, like:-
[code]<NPCLoc> <id>100</id> <startX>555</startX> <startY>666</startY> <minX>555</minX> <maxX>555</maxX> <minY>666</minY> <maxY>666</maxY> </NPCLoc>[/code]
Of course I just added in any random numbers, but would that be how i'd instigate making an NPC stick to 1 place, without movement?
After adding the NPC into NpcLoc.xml, I then noticed the file NpcHandlers.xml. More help on using the NpcHandlers.xml would be appreciated.
Ok, so to add in an NPC, all I need to change is "NpcLoc" and "NpcHandlers".xml? -_-;
Also, if I can get an NPC into the game, in which file i'm able to make him talk to a player when the player clicks the npc.
Any help is much appreciated and will be fully helpfully.
Take care and thanks in advance ^^
Regards,
~Yong-Min

item.title: A Few Questions
item.dc:creator: @pesterd pesterd
item.description:
@pesterd wrote:

[quote=“yong min, post:5, topic:260188”]I’ll have a more thorough search through things.

Thank you.[/quote]
your welcome if there is anything else that you cant find tho, post and people will answer straight away

Read full topic

item.title: A Few Questions
item.dc:creator: @pesterd pesterd
item.description:
@pesterd wrote:

Yes Yong, and the coordinates you put were correct. I dont think you need to place the final file into the compression tool if you have the EASY Rsc but im not sure.

Good luck

Read full topic

item.title: A Few Questions
item.dc:creator: @yong_min yong min
item.description:
@yong_min wrote:

Hello there.

I have a few questions, and would appreciate any help you may be able to provide.

I am not a native English speaker; so my English isn’t as a standard English fluentacy, so i’ll make my apology now ^^

I am going away tomorrow, due to bad weather (snowing), flights are being delayed -_-;
^So i’d appreciate a quick response, if you’re not busy.

While i’m away, I decided to use RSC server on a localhost, as i’ll be far too busy to stay online to play a server; this way I can use it when i’m free and also use for educational purposes, to get a real insight to the game, aswell as playing it.

Here are a few my questions; please correct any information that is incorrect.

I’m using EasyRSC created by xEnt. I also have everything required to using RSCD_V25 too.

I basically want to know a few basic things, hope to add NPC’s, make it possible to talk with an NPC; etc

  1. Changing names of NPC’s:- I’ve been looking through and taking looks at xml document, and believe this is done in the NPCdef.xml

  2. NPC drops/rates:- I believe this is done in NPCdef.xml also.

From looking through NPCdef.xml, I also can clearly see that here you can change the Hits, Strength, Defense and Attack of an Npc, also respawn rates of time. *The rest i’ll not bother touching, as i’m not 100% sure what will happen. With the drop rates, I am aware of the weight procedure, and will try a few things with that to get a decent drop rates.

  1. Changing names of Items:- I believe by looking through ItemDef.xml, this is the correct place to change the name of an item.

  2. Changing prices of shop items:- This is still quite unfamiliar to me. I see that in ItemDef.xml you have a x amount , which i’m thinking this would be the price when “selling” an item to the shop, not buying. Can anyone tell me where I can change the price of items that are already in-store.

  3. Editing weapons/armours statistics:- I believe this can be done through Itemwieldabledef.xml, thanks to a great and informative tutorial that I read whilst looking through the search button.

  4. Adding NPC’s:- Also with this one, i’m not entirely sure. It also gets into a little confusion of what to edit. I am thinking that if I want to create a “new” npc, I can do this also in NPCDef.xml, making it drop new things, altering it’s statistics, etc.

^I also believe i’d have to create the NPC’s locations in NpcLoc.xml. My question with this is: How do I make an NPC stay on 1 place, without moving. For example:- Would I just use all the same coords, like:-

<NPCLoc> <id>100</id> <startX>555</startX> <startY>666</startY> <minX>555</minX> <maxX>555</maxX> <minY>666</minY> <maxY>666</maxY> </NPCLoc>

Of course I just added in any random numbers, but would that be how i’d instigate making an NPC stick to 1 place, without movement?

After adding the NPC into NpcLoc.xml, I then noticed the file NpcHandlers.xml. More help on using the NpcHandlers.xml would be appreciated.

Ok, so to add in an NPC, all I need to change is “NpcLoc” and “NpcHandlers”.xml? -_-;

Also, if I can get an NPC into the game, in which file i’m able to make him talk to a player when the player clicks the npc.

Any help is much appreciated and will be fully helpfully.

Take care and thanks in advance ^^

Regards,

~Yong-Min
